Questionnaire.title: Warehouse & Inventory Management (WIM) Technical Assessment
Questionnaire.description: Converted from the 'WIM technical assessment' to match the sample HR Assessment XML template. Includes background details and core competency self-ratings on a 5-point Likert scale.

item.text: 1. Background information
1.1. Gender
1.2. Designation / Job Title
1.3. Select your role in chosen directorate
1.4. Please select your Job Grade
1.5. Your Education Profile (highest level)
Subject of highest degree
1.6.1 Total years of work experience
1.6.2 Years working in EPSA
1.7. Training received in the past two years (select all that apply)

answerOption.valueString: I have not participated in any training in the past year

item.text: If 'Other', please specify
1.8.1 Has the training you received helped improve your professional competency?
1.8.2 What types of competencies did the training help improve? (select all that apply)
1.8.3 Have you noticed any change/improvement in your work after the training?
2. Technical Assessment: Quantification and Supply Planning
Competency Area 1: Manage Receipt, Physical Inspection and Storage of Commodities
The methods and practices used in receiving and storing commodities and equipment in warehouse deliveries
The safe handling, storage and movement of commodities
Warehouse plans, techniques of material handling and stock control
Principles and systems used for the physical storage of stock and good storage practices including FEFO
Warehouse planning and documentation requirements; accepted methods, procedures and techniques
Special handling processes like cold chain and high value risk security
Monitor temperature control in the warehouses
Stock quality monitoring
Segregate damaged commodities, reconstitute, document and report
Methods of distribution of commodities to branches, facilities and warehouses through a logistics network
Knowledge of warehousing information systems
Design, implementation and management of inventory control systems
Legal requirements related to store management (e.g., health & safety, hazardous materials)
Safety procedures in warehouse
Use checklists in receipt and storage of items from suppliers
Operating the warehouse equipment safely
Stock, move, arrange and rotate warehouse items in accordance with SOPs
Prepare and complete forms for incoming supplies (description, quantity, unit, labeling)
Identify obvious damage to equipment and commodities through visual inspections
Determine layout of storage space and establish item and commodity location
Determine sequences for loading and unloading shipments for space utilization and safety
Obtain and collate data on supplies being stored and manage stock differences
Adopt a total systems approach to the flow of information, materials and services
Evaluate the demand for supplies and determine storage capacity and requirements
Maintenance of safe and appropriate systems of work
Develop and follow organizational processes, instructions, rules and parameters for WIM
Apply inventory control techniques to manage stock-outs and overstocks
Develop storage strategies and plans; oversee implementation and effectiveness
Develop policies and procedures for stock handling, distribution and withdrawal consistent with safety
Develop storage strategies that meet organizational needs and optimize supply chain costs
Competency Area 2: Issue, Pick, Dispatch and Replenish Commodities
Requirements of general warehouse layout, item identification and warehouse procedures
Requirements of storage areas to pull stock and materials in accordance with procedures
Record issues, losses and adjustments; balance on hand; batch/lot numbers and expiry dates
Define and explain the specification requirements for procurement
Support the procurement process with respect to technical specifications
Ensure specifications are unbiased and in line with EFDA requirements
Conduct research and demonstrate creativity in developing complex specifications
Competency Area 3: Undertake quantification analysis and forecast commodity needs
Principles and applications for demand forecasting
Critical requirements like time horizons, use of data and level of detail
Principles and methodology of quantification
Consumption method for forecasting
Morbidity method for forecasting
Service level method for forecasting
Reconciliation methods like ABC and VEN
Methods of data analysis and other analytical methods
Specific forecasting requirements for HIV/TB/Malaria/RMNCH commodities
Tools for quantification like Quantimed
Requirements for data consolidation
Calculate current and future commodity needs based on consumption levels
Specific requirements from FMOH or Donors
Critical risks in forecasting
Budgeting requirements in forecasting
Develop tools for collection of consumption data
Develop tools for forecasting using appropriate methods
Use software such as Quantimed for quantifying commodities
Aggregate and validate forecasts from various EPSA hubs/branches
Reconcile needs for commodities based on available funds
Analyze information and decide which forecasting method to use
Understand and identify factors that affect consumption patterns
Facilitate dialogue between RHBs and facilities to reconcile forecasts
Forecast budgetary requirements based on programme needs
Establish internal policies and procedures for quantification and forecasting control
Establish key performance indicators of forecasting accuracy
Identify and manage the risks that affect user demand and supply; adopt mitigation strategies
Competency Area 4: Manage Supply Planning
Concepts of inventory management systems
Principles of integrated distribution systems
Requirements for supply in emergency situations
Special requirements for temperature-sensitive commodities (cold chain)
Requirements, guidelines and process for supply planning
Monitor stock status from branches and assess commodity stock status
Monitor in-transit commodities and procurement records
Develop supply plans based on associated datasets
Coordinate and manage development of supply plans
Conduct research and demonstrate creativity in developing complex supply plans
Communicate with branches on established supply plans to take feedback
